intro: Polybotrya hickeyi, commonly known as the Hickey's polybotrya, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form with small, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of white to pinkish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
